intro: Machaeranthera spectabilis, commonly known as showy tickseed, is a flowering plant native to the United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in prairies and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and its flowers bloom in late summer to early fall. Showy tickseed is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
